patchouli.flame_chase_artifacts.book.cat: §f(Beginner's Guide) How to Play Tetra Smithing
$(#ffffff)   This section focuses primarily on [Tool Leveling with Hammers], providing readers with a simple explanation on how to upgrade hammer tool levels and craft better tools.
patchouli.flame_chase_artifacts.book.ent: §fTool and Material Levels

$(#ffffff)   In Tetra's vanilla version, material levels range from 1 to 6, corresponding to six tiers: $(#513917)Wood$(#ffffff), $(#7f7f7f)Stone$(#ffffff), $(#fdf55f)Gold$(#ffffff), $(#d8d8d8)Iron/Blackstone$(#ffffff), $(#8cf4e2)Diamond/Obsidian$(#ffffff), and $(#595659)Netherite$(#ffffff). To break through level 7, you need to perform polishing, Nether Star inlays, or download additional mods. $(br)   $(bold)Hammer and Pickaxe$(#ffffff) tool components$(bold) have a default -1 tool level$(#ffffff) due to the 'Synergy' effect between hammer heads and pickaxe heads: when both ends of a dual-headed tool are made of $(bold)the same material$(#ffffff) (hammer or pickaxe heads), it will grant an additional +1 tool level.

$(#ffffff)   Regarding hammer tools, it's important to note that hammers differ from other tools in that they cannot use 'Gems' as component materials. Therefore, you cannot directly craft a level 5 hammer using diamond materials (which correspond to level 5). Additionally, the required tool levels for Obsidian and Netherite when crafting hammers are level 6 and level 7, respectively. $(br)   To craft high-level hammers, you'll need to seek out $(bold)[Smithing Ruins]$(#ffffff) to obtain $(bold)[Smithing Hammers]$(#ffffff) and a series of other items/blocks. Detailed explanations about this will be covered later in the guide.
§fWorkbench & GUI Guide

$(#ffffff)   Right-click a workbench with a hammer tool to obtain Tetra's core workstation - the Processing Bench. $(br)   Unlike the well-known modular equipment mod 'Tinker's Construct', Tetra requires you to first craft a vanilla tool, then perform any operation on it at the Processing Bench to transform it into a Tetra tool. $(br)   Vanilla tools that can be modularized include: swords, two-handed tools (pickaxes/axes/hoes), one-handed tools (shovels/tridents), bows, crossbows, shields, and tool belts.

$(#ffffff)   After selecting the desired tool component to craft, the GUI will switch to the crafting interface. This interface can be accessed by selecting the middle option among the three options on the left side of the GUI. $(br)   The crafting interface displays the icon of the target tool component, its description, and material slots. After placing eligible items in the slots, the required tool level and experience level (if needed) for crafting will be displayed. $(br)   (For more details about material slots, please refer to the next page)

$(#ffffff)   On the left side of the component material slots, there are two icons (upper and lower) that respectively show the material's impact on the component's attributes and the types or names of materials available for this component. $(br)   The base attributes of materials include hardness/density/toughness, which will affect the values of the crafted components. It is recommended to check these before crafting. $(br)   When hovering over the lower icon, if a hologram sphere is present in the vicinity or in your inventory, you can left-click to quickly jump to the corresponding hologram interface.

$(#ffffff)   Select the upper option among the three options on the left side of the GUI to access the details interface. $(br)   The details interface displays another description of the component (which may be the same as the crafting interface description, depending on the component author), the items required to repair the component, the available synergy effects and types of the component, the currently used magic capacity, and the current stability. $(br)   (Synergy effects and component types are located in the small icons to the left of the repair materials. Hover over them to view details)

$(#ffffff)   Select the lower option among the three options on the left side of the GUI to access the adjustment interface. $(br)   In the adjustment interface, a draggable [Bolt Tightness] slider will appear in the center. Hold down the glowing area with the left mouse button or click the desired adjustment position to modify the tool's data. The data affected by bolt tightness varies depending on the tool type.

$(#ffffff)   Click the hammer icon below the tool to access the repair interface. $(br)   The repair interface allows you to fix damaged and worn components. It cycles through the materials used in crafting each component and consumes experience points based on the tool's enchantments. Each repaired component will be highlighted in white at the bottom.
§fTool Rack

$(#ffffff)   The Tool Rack allows you to hang tools on it by right-clicking it with a tool in hand. Tools hanging on the rack within a 3-block radius of the Processing Bench or Forge Bench can be used directly without occupying inventory slots. $(br)   Priority: Tool in hand > Tool on the rack > Forge Hammer. Therefore, when using the Planar Stabilizer Forge Hammer, you need to remove hammers from nearby tool racks; otherwise, the high quality will be lost.
§fHolographic Sphere

$(#ffffff)   When you first obtain a hammer-type tool from the mod, you will receive a Holographic Sphere. Please note that if the Holographic Sphere is lost, it can only be obtained again by finding Forge Ruins to gather crafting materials and synthesizing it. $(br)   The Holographic Sphere can be right-clicked to open an interface to view the attributes of various tools, modules, and materials. It can also be used while held in the inventory to left-click the icon on the left side of the material slot in the Processing Bench crafting interface to directly view the attributes of the corresponding materials for that component. However, it cannot view the attributes of components provided by wrapped handles or blueprints.

$(#ffffff)   The Holographic Sphere can be right-clicked to place it on the ground. When the Holographic Sphere is in the player's inventory or near the Processing Bench, the bottom-left corner of the material slots used to craft components will display the material type or name, and you can left-click to quickly jump to the Holographic Sphere interface.

$(#ffffff)   The Holographic Sphere has two upgrade slots. After installing the Scanner Upgrade using an Ender Eye as a material, it can be used to locate Forge Blocks (Ancient Debris also counts as a Forge Block) underground. $(br)   When holding an activated Holographic Sphere with scanning functionality, a scanning indicator with three rows of white dots will appear at the top of the screen. When Forge Blocks are within the scanning range, the corresponding white dots in the approximate direction will turn red and emit a sound effect (the sound effect can be heard even without holding the sphere), with the indicator turning redder and the sound louder as the distance decreases. $(br)   If only the top row / bottom row of the three rows of white dots lights up, it indicates that the ruin location is above / below.

$(#ffffff)   Additionally, the Holographic Sphere can be upgraded with 4 Amethysts. After upgrading, the Holographic Sphere can be sneak-right-clicked to place it on the ground, and pressing V then right-clicking with any hammer enables long-distance scanning. Each point represents a chunk, with higher points indicating higher coordinates. The color of the points represents the biome color, and when a ruin from this mod is scanned, the point will turn red. $(br)   By default, each hammer strike scans four chunks in a 40-degree cone relative to the direction of the Holographic Sphere from the player. Each level of the hammer increases the cone size by 12 degrees, and each level of efficiency increases the number of scanned chunks by 1/4.
§fHammer Leveling Process Overview

$(#ffffff)   For Tetra hammers of levels 1-2, you can directly craft them using sticks and wooden planks/stone. It is recommended that players craft two hammers, as another hammer is needed as a tool when modifying hammer components. $(br)   Level 3 hammers only require replacing the hammer head material with iron, while level 4 hammers require obtaining blackstone from the Nether. $(br)   Starting from levels 5-6, you need to locate [Forge Ruins] to acquire the Forge Bench and Forge Hammer within. (Note: Not every ruin will generate a complete set of equipment; there may be only one or none at all.)

$(#ffffff)   Before entering the Forge Ruins, it is recommended that players prepare a horned hammer and a regular hammer to gather resources from within. Details about the blocks and resources in the Forge Ruins will be explained in another chapter; they will not be covered in detail here. $(br)   After obtaining $(#d16f20)Heat Unit x2$(#ffffff), $(#d16f20)Forge Bench$(#ffffff), $(#d16f20)Forge Hammer$(#ffffff), and $(#d16f20)Combustion Chamber$(#ffffff), players can begin crafting level 5/6 hammers. $(br)   It should be noted that the Forge Hammer itself is equivalent to a level 5 forging hammer. If equipped with a Combustion Chamber accessory, it can be considered a level 6/7 hammer, which serves as the foundation for crafting Obsidian or Netherite hammers.

$(#ffffff)   By equipping the Forge Hammer with a Combustion Chamber and Heat Units, you can craft hammer heads made of obsidian and Netherite materials. If you only have one Combustion Chamber or insufficient Netherite, you can consider polishing the Obsidian hammer to increase its efficiency level, thereby indirectly achieving a level 5 hammer.

$(#ffffff)   If you wish to further increase the level of a level 6 Netherite hammer after crafting it, you can either polish it multiple times to enhance its hammer level or inlay a Nether Star. $(br)   Both of these methods allow you to increase the hammer's efficiency level without altering its material. In modpacks that restrict players from accessing the Nether, the former method can be used to obtain a level 4 hammer in the Overworld.
§fGeode Jade

$(#ffffff)   Geode blocks generate below level 0, resembling deepslate in appearance but occasionally emitting white particle effects. When mined, they always drop one Geode Jade, unaffected by Fortune or Haste enchantments. $(br)   In this mod's workbench, Geode Jade can be broken using a hammer of level 2 or higher, with the inventory order of hammers taking priority. Breaking the Geode Jade will yield flint, iron nuggets, gold nuggets, lapis lazuli, redstone, emerald, diamond, and flawless gems. $(br)   The drop rates are influenced by the Fortune enchantment on the hammer, which increases the quantities of flint, emerald, diamond, and flawless gems.
§fFlawless Gem

$(#ffffff)   Flawless Gems can be obtained by breaking Geode Jade on the Processing Bench with a chance, and can be inlaid onto Tetra tools as an inlay material. Additionally, they can be shattered using hammer tools into more corresponding gem materials, with the quantity affected by the Fortune enchantment.

$(#ffffff)   When used as an inlay component, the Flawless Lapis Lazuli provides a level 2 Intuition (Experience Sharpening) effect and increases durability slightly. $(br)   Intuition: When holding the tool, each point of experience gained increases the [Attribute Level] points of Sharpening Value (Lapis Lazuli is level 1), or increases Sharpening Value based on the damage dealt by tools with this component when killing mobs.

$(#ffffff)   When used as an inlay component, the Flawless Amethyst provides 1 point of Reach and Attack Range, a 40%% Long Arm effect, and increases durability slightly. $(br)   Long Arm: The farther the distance from the target, the higher the mining efficiency and damage, along with increased speed and Cutting Level.
$(#ffffff)   When used as an inlay component, the Flawless Emerald provides a 30%% Critical Hit Chance and 200%% Critical Hit Damage, and increases durability slightly.
$(#ffffff)   When used as an inlay component, the Flawless Diamond provides a 20%% Attack Damage Bonus, improves tool efficiency, and increases medium durability.
§fSpecial Bow Modifications

$(#ffffff)   From the Forge Ruins, players can obtain Bolts, Quick-Release Pins, and Planar Stabilizers. Bolts can be crafted into Arrow Rests with configurable attribute values, Quick-Release Pins can be used to improve bowstrings, and Planar Stabilizers can be used to enhance bow arms. For details, refer to the [Forge Ruins] section. $(br)   Bolts can use the 'Configuration' page to balance attributes such as Draw Time and Arrow Speed. $(br)   Quick-Release Pins can increase Draw Speed and grant the bow Auto-Fire capability. $(br)   Planar Stabilizers allow arrows to fly without gravity and increase arrow flight speed by 20%%.
patchouli.flame_chase_artifacts.book.cat: $(#ffffff)   This section mainly explains the various blocks and resources within the [Forge Ruins] (Extractor Ruin) to help players explore the structures more easily.
patchouli.flame_chase_artifacts.book.ent: §fMetal Scrap

$(#ffffff)   Metal Scrap can be obtained by opening Forge Chests or Forge Containers, or by destroying items within Tetra ruins with a level 5 or higher hammer without the Fortune enchantment. $(br)   It can be used to repair tools assembled from Tetra materials, recycled into metal ingots or metal nuggets on the Processing Bench, or traded with wandering traders for Tetra materials.
§fForged Wall/Column/Platform

$(#ffffff)   These blocks naturally generate within the Forge Ruins. They have no special functions and are purely decorative, making them suitable materials for building a dedicated forge room. $(br)   Please note that directly destroying them will only drop a certain amount of Metal Scrap. They must be collected using a level 6 hammer with the Fortune enchantment (only the Netherite Hammer in vanilla meets this standard).
§fForge Workbench

$(#ffffff)   The Forge Workbench cannot be crafted in vanilla and only generates randomly within the Forge Ruins. Its primary purpose is to serve as a Processing Bench (not mandatory, as a regular Processing Bench can be used under the Forge Hammer). $(br)   The Forge Workbench is fireproof and requires a hammer with the Fortune enchantment to be fully collected. Otherwise, it will only drop Metal Scrap.
§fForge Hammer and Its Plugins

$(#ffffff)   The Forge Hammer cannot be crafted in vanilla and only generates randomly within the Forge Ruins. It requires a hammer with the Fortune enchantment to be collected; otherwise, it will only drop Metal Scrap. It is equivalent to a level 5 hammer. $(br)   For the Forge Hammer to function properly, two Heat Units (square slots) and two Plugins (rectangular slots) need to be installed on its sides, and an empty space should be left below it where a Forge Workbench or a regular Processing Bench can be placed (the Forge Workbench is not mandatory). $(br)   Additionally, the Forge Hammer may get jammed after operation and needs to be repaired by right-clicking the lower edge of the hammer head with a level 4 hammer.

$(#ffffff)   Heat Units cannot be crafted and can be obtained by opening Forge Containers or Forge Crates within the Forge Ruins. The Forge Hammers and Transfer Units generated in the Forge Ruins also have a chance to come with Heat Units. $(br)   Their purpose is to power the Forge Hammer. Normally, a Forge Hammer without any plugin bonuses can forge 10 times. $(br)   The durability of Heat Units needs to be restored through the Thermal Extractor structure, but in version 1.20.1, they can be enchanted with Mending.

$(#ffffff)   The Combustion Chamber cannot be crafted and can only be obtained within the Forge Ruins by opening Forge Containers or Forge Crates. $(br)   Its purpose is to be installed on the Forge Hammer, increasing the forging level by 1. The side effect is that the Forge Hammer may randomly ignite blocks within a 3-block radius while working.

$(#ffffff)   The Planar Stabilizer cannot be crafted and can only be obtained within the Forge Ruins by opening Forge Containers or Forge Crates. $(br)   Its primary purpose is to, when installed on the Forge Hammer, add a [High - Quality] 1/2 improvement effect to the crafted tools based on the number of installations. $(br)   In addition, the Planar Stabilizer can be installed on a bow as a stabilizer, allowing arrows to ignore gravity and increasing their flight speed. $(br)   Moreover, the Planar Stabilizer can be installed as a belt component, enabling unlimited hovering within the beacon range (no ascending).

$(#ffffff)   The Insulation Plate can only be obtained within the Forge Ruins by opening Forge Containers or Forge Crates. $(br)   Its primary purpose is to be installed on the Forge Hammer and Transfer Units to improve the working efficiency of the machine (it reduces energy consumption when installed on the Forge Hammer). $(br)   Additionally, it can be used as a shield face (a shield component, limited to tower shields) and requires a level 4 hammer to craft (it has high durability but slow speed).

$(#ffffff)   The Lubricant Emitter cannot be crafted and can only be obtained within the Forge Ruins by opening Forge Containers or Forge Crates. $(br)   Its primary purpose is to be installed on the Forge Hammer, and each installed Lubricant Emitter reduces the failure rate by 50%%.
§fForge Vent

$(#ffffff)   Forge Vents naturally generate within the Forge Ruins and cannot be crafted. $(br)   To dismantle a Forge Vent, strike the corner of all connected vents once with a level 3 or higher hammer, then pry any vent's center with a crowbar. Upon disassembly, it will randomly yield either a Metal Block or a Structure Beam.
§fForge Container

$(#ffffff)   Forge Containers naturally generate within the Forge Ruins. The containers spawned in the ruins come with random loot, typically including Tetra materials, Redstone components, Minecart components, and various minerals. $(br)   When generated in the Forge Ruins, the container is secured by four lock mechanisms, requiring a level 3 or higher hammer tool to break the locks. After successfully breaking all locks, a prying tool with a horned head is needed to open it.

$(#ffffff)   $(br)   Forge Containers can be used for decoration or storage, but they must be collected using a level 6 hammer with the Fortune enchantment (only the Netherite Hammer in vanilla meets this standard). It features the storage capacity of three large chests and allows page switching via the left column. $(br)[Friendly reminder: it has multiple pages！Be sure to flip through the pages when searching for loot to ensure nothing is missed！]$(br)【Never try to carry it with Carry On！】
§fForge Crate

$(#ffffff)   Forge Crates naturally generate within the Forge Ruins, cannot be crafted, and are affected by gravity. $(br)   To open, right-click the corresponding position on the container with a hammer or a tool equipped with a horned head when the attack charge is full. A white indicator means it can definitely be opened, yellow indicates a chance to open, and red means it cannot be opened.

$(#ffffff)   Upon opening, a Forge Crate will randomly drop one of the following items with varying charge levels: a Heat Unit, a quantity of Metal Scrap or Flexible Mesh, a Planar Stabilizer, an Insulation Plate, a Lubricant Emitter, a Combustion Chamber, a Structure Beam, or an Underground Extractor.
§fThermal Extractor Structure

$(#ffffff)   The Thermal Extractor Structure consists of four block types: Extraction Pipes, Core Extractors, Transfer Units, and Seepage Bedrock. All components are essential, and the Extraction Pipes must be connected to the Seepage Bedrock below to function. $(br)   To locate it, you can usually search around the -57 height level within the Forge Ruins area. $(br)   Purpose of the Thermal Extractor: Used for charging Thermal Batteries.

$(#ffffff)   Extraction Pipes are located below the Core Extractor within the structure. They can be rotated or extended, but the end must be connected to Seepage Bedrock for the structure to operate properly. When successfully connected to Seepage Bedrock, the pipe surface will emit an orange glow.
$(#ffffff)   The Core Extractor is positioned above the Extraction Pipes within the structure. During operation, pistons move up and down. It can function even if there are blocks blocking the top.

$(#ffffff)   Transfer Units need to be installed on the side of the Core Extractor and are used to place Heat Units above for charging. $(br)   To use, align the Transfer Unit's front with a horned hammer to adjust the gear setting, which ranges from left to right as A, B, and C gears. Gear A is the output mode, discharging the Thermal Battery; Gear B is the input mode, charging the Thermal Battery; Gear C's function is currently unknown. $(br)   Additionally, if an Exhaust Plate is not installed, the machine will lose one-eighth of its energy during both input and output operations.
§fQuick-Release Pin

$(#ffffff)   The Quick-Release Pin can be obtained from Forge Containers or traded with wandering merchants. It serves as an upgrade attachment for bowstrings or belt loops. $(br)   When used to enhance a bowstring, it increases the bow's draw speed and enables auto-fire (automatically shooting when fully drawn and immediately entering the next draw cycle). $(br)   When installed on a belt loop, it allows players to automatically switch to the appropriate tool by pressing the 'Switch Tool' key while looking at a block they wish to mine.
§fBolt

$(#ffffff)   Bolts can be crafted, obtained by opening Forge Containers/Crates, or purchased from wandering merchants. $(br)   They can be used as materials for bow components such as arrow rests and arm adjusters, as well as binding materials. $(br)   Tools/weapons equipped with such components can use the 'Configuration' page to balance their attributes. For example, reducing draw time while decreasing arrow speed and power for bows, adjusting durability and damage for weapons, or tuning tool efficiency and durability for tools.
§fAncient Schematic

$(#ffffff)   Ancient Schematics typically generate on walls within rooms that contain Processing Benches and have a chance to be in a damaged state. Unlike other blocks in the Forge Ruins, they must be pried from behind the block pattern using a horned head tool of level 1 or higher. $(br)   When placed within the effective range of a Processing Bench, Ancient Schematics unlock related component schematics for the bench, but all undamaged parts must be collected.
patchouli.flame_chase_artifacts.book.cat: $(#ffffff)   This section primarily introduces attributes of Tetra tools such as [Integrity] and [Magic Capacity] to help players understand these attributes.
patchouli.flame_chase_artifacts.book.ent: §fIntegrity

$(#ffffff)   Integrity represents the number of times a tool can be modified. Most materials used in crafting components either consume or provide integrity, and most sharpening and component improvements also consume integrity. $(br)   Regarding integrity acquisition: actions such as stabilizing a tool (e.g., switching to a handle that provides higher integrity, long-term use of the tool to achieve [Stability], or using layered enhancement swords) will increase the tool's available integrity, allowing for more modifications.
§fSharpening and Improvements

$(#ffffff)   Sharpening enhances component attributes by consuming integrity. In vanilla, level 2 and level 4 sharpening each consume 1 point of integrity, while improvements consume integrity based on their type. Each use of the tool increases its sharpening value; small round shields and swords equipped with wide guards also gain sharpening value when attacked. When the sharpening value reaches a certain threshold, a sound effect will play, indicating that sharpening is possible. $(br)   Sharpening can only be applied to the main components of a tool, which are generally the components without the option to remove them.

$(#ffffff)   Sharpening/Improvements available in vanilla include: Speed, Damage, Durability, Efficiency, Mining Efficiency, Mining Level (unlocked after reaching Mining Efficiency sharpening level 5), etc. Improvements, such as adding a wrapped handle to a component or warforging without altering the tool material, are also considered types of improvements.
§fMagic Capacity

$(#ffffff)   Magic Capacity is provided by materials. Enchantments on components consume Magic Capacity, and exceeding the capacity limit will impose negative effects on the component, such as requiring experience to repair it. $(br)【This mechanism was not implemented before version 6.10 and is only introduced here; no need to worry about it. Subsequent pages will cover the negative effects added in version 6.10 and later.】

$(#ffffff)   Burden: Increases damage and efficiency but reduces swing speed. $(br)   $(br)   Hunger: Slowly consumes the wielder's saturation while using the tool. $(br)   $(br)   Mount: Increases mining efficiency and damage when the wielder is riding an entity, and decreases them otherwise.

$(#ffffff)   Firewood: Has a chance to ignite blocks within a certain range when using the tool. $(br)   $(br)   Satiety: Gains less experience from actions but obtains a stackable "Satiety" buff. $(br)["Satiety": Prevents a certain amount of saturation consumption, but does not affect natural health regeneration-induced saturation consumption.]

$(#ffffff)   Suffocation: Increases mining efficiency and damage when the wielder is low on oxygen, and decreases them otherwise. $(br)   $(br)   Evocation: Has a chance to spawn Illusionary Vexes when using the tool. $(br)["Illusionary Creatures": Killing them grants temporary mining speed and damage boosts; Illusionary Creatures have a limited lifespan and only one of the same type can exist at a time.]

$(#ffffff)   Infection: Has a chance to spawn Illusionary Endermites when using the tool. $(br)   $(br)   Drilling: Increases mining efficiency and damage when Y < 0, and decreases them otherwise. $(br)   $(br)   Ascension: Increases mining efficiency and damage when Y > 0, and decreases them otherwise.

$(#ffffff)   Exile: Increases mining efficiency and damage when the wielder has the Bad Omen effect, and decreases them otherwise. $(br)   $(br)   Hero: Increases mining efficiency and damage when the wielder has the Hero of the Village effect, and decreases them otherwise.

$(#ffffff)   Moonchild: Increases mining efficiency and damage during a full moon, and decreases them otherwise. $(br)   $(br)   Bloodlink: Has a chance to consume the wielder's health instead of tool durability when using the tool, with the consumption ratio depending on the curse level.
§fReinforce

$(#ffffff)   Reinforce Level increases as the tool is used. However, Reinforce Level is calculated individually for each component, and only primary components possess Reinforce Level. When Reinforce Level reaches a certain value, a sound effect will play and a notification will appear, indicating that the Reinforce Tier of that component has been upgraded. Standard materials provide an additional 1 point of Integrity when reinforcing. Some mods may modify the reinforcing effects of materials. $(br)   There is a cap on Reinforce Level, and when the durability of the component material is high, the Reinforce Level required to increase Integrity will also be higher.
§fSynergies

$(#ffffff)   Synergies refer to the effects triggered when a tool is equipped with components or materials that meet the synergy requirements. The most common example is having two pickaxe heads and two hammer heads. Synergies can be viewed by selecting the top-left option when crafting components.
patchouli.flame_chase_artifacts.book.cat: $(#ffffff)   This section primarily introduces auxiliary tool crafting scrolls such as [Material Specialization Scroll], [Tool Efficiency Scroll], [Gilding Scroll], [Warforging Scroll], and [Unique Modifications] to help players craft tools more effectively. $(br)   Except for the Esoteric Record, all scrolls need to be placed within a 5x5x5 range of the Processing Bench to take effect. The Esoteric Record must be placed directly above the Processing Bench to function.
patchouli.flame_chase_artifacts.book.ent: §fMaterial Specialization & Tool Efficiency Scrolls

$(#ffffff)   Specialization Scrolls are divided into Material Specialization and Tool Efficiency. Material Specialization can add a High-Quality I enhancement to the primary components of materials being crafted (High-Quality II enhancement can be crafted using a Forge Hammer equipped with two Planar Stabilizers). Multiple scrolls cannot be stacked, and the High-Quality effect does not stack for identical components (e.g., two pickaxe components). $(br)   Tool Efficiency Scrolls grant a 25%% chance to reduce material consumption by 1 when crafting or modifying tools with the corresponding tool, but consumption will not be reduced to zero. Multiple scrolls cannot be stacked.
$(#ffffff)   [Specialization: Bone Expertise] is obtained through trading with Butchers.
$(#ffffff)   [Specialization: Wool Expertise] is obtained through trading with Shepherds.
$(#ffffff)   [Specialization: Gem Expertise] and [Specialization: Stone Expertise] are obtained through trading with Stonemasons.
$(#ffffff)   [Specialization: Metal Expertise] and [Specialization: Hammer Efficiency] are obtained through trading with Weaponsmiths, Toolsmiths, and Armorers.
$(#ffffff)   [Specialization: Scale Expertise], [Specialization: Leather Expertise], and [Specialization: Knife Efficiency] are obtained through trading with Leatherworkers.
$(#ffffff)   [Specialization: Scale Expertise], [Specialization: Leather Expertise], and [Specialization: Axe Efficiency] are obtained through trading with Fletchers.
§fUnique Modification Scrolls

$(#ffffff)   The original Unique Modification Scrolls are obtained from loot chests and come in three types: [Throwing Knife], [Steadfast Guardian], and [Windblade]. Placing the scroll within a 5x5x3 (height) range around the Processing Bench unlocks the modification.

$(#ffffff)   [Throwing Knife]: Right-clicking the weapon allows you to charge and throw it to deal damage, functioning as a lower-tier Trident. When any throwable item from the mod is thrown, if the mining level and mining speed exceed the block's mining level and hardness, the block will be destroyed and dropped as an item. $(br)   It is known that when a Throwing Knife is simultaneously enchanted with Loyalty and Channeling, and the player's inventory and item slots are full with nearby dropped items, throwing the knife may cause it to disappear, and the picked-up item will inexplicably increase by one. When only Loyalty is enchanted, it remains unaffected; in this case, if the inventory and item slots are full, the Throwing Knife will force the player to discard one item slot back to the inventory.

$(#ffffff)   [Steadfast Guardian]: Unlocks the Steadfast Guard forging in the Guard slot. After forging, right-clicking it allows you to block damage for a certain duration. Whether the block bar is depleted or you simply right-click, it will enter a fixed cooldown period.
$(#ffffff)   [Windblade]: Gains the Whirlwind trait. This trait reduces the player's movement speed and has a chance to deflect incoming projectiles.
§fGilding Scrolls

$(#ffffff)   A Gilding I Scroll can be found in each loot chest within the Nether Fortress. Two scrolls of the same level can be crafted into a higher-level scroll, with a maximum level of five. $(br)   When placed on the Processing Bench, Gilding Scrolls provide a new sharpening option: Gilding, after the tool's sharpening level is maxed out. It consumes experience levels and gold nuggets to enhance the selected component's Magic Capacity, thereby preventing various issues caused by exceeding the Magic Capacity limit implemented in version 6.10. $(br)   [Ignorable for versions below 6.10].
§fWarforging Scrolls

$(#ffffff)   Obtained through trading with Piglins, these scrolls can only be used to modify two-handed tools, specializing them towards attack-oriented enhancements. $(br)   Warforging provides a passive skill based on the two-handed tool's primary component, an active skill enhancement for the left component, and an active skill enhancement for the right component. After using an active skill, all Tetra tools in your inventory will enter a cooldown, regardless of their capabilities. Each Warforging consumes 2 Integrity.

$(#ffffff)【Battleaxe】——Axe Head $(br)   Passive: Cleaving — Attacks have a chance to reduce the target's maximum health. $(br)   Skill: Execute — Deals additional damage based on lost health and attack effects. $(br)   Enhancement: Overcharge — Skills can be further charged to increase damage and effects.

$(#ffffff)【Warhammer】——Hammer Head $(br)   Passive: Shattering — Attacks ignore the target's armor. $(br)   Skill: Smash — Delivers a powerful knockback to a single target or strikes multiple enemies within a large area. $(br)   Enhancement: Inertia — Causes skills to stun or knockback targets.

$(#ffffff)【Warpick】——Pickaxe Head $(br)   Passive: Piercing — Attacks deal additional damage to unarmored targets. $(br)   Skill: Impale — Reduces the target's armor value or causes bleeding. $(br)   Enhancement: Combo — Gains combo points from regular attacks that can enhance abilities.

$(#ffffff)【Blunt End】——Tool Tail $(br)   Lightweight — Significantly increases speed but reduces the tool level. $(br)   Skill: None. $(br)   Enhancement: Lightweight — Reduces skill charge time and cooldown time.

$(#ffffff)【Warclaw】——Horned Head $(br)   Passive: Armor Penetration — Attacks ignore part of the armor. $(br)   Skill: Pry — Applies stacking armor reduction effects to the target. $(br)   Enhancement: Vengeance — Enhances abilities when the wielder is at a disadvantage.

$(#ffffff)【Warhoe】——Hoe Head $(br)   Passive: Extra Damage — Increases the weapon's overall damage. $(br)   Skill: Suppress — Deals high damage, but both parties enter an Exhausted effect. $(br)   Enhancement: Overcharge — Abilities become more effective but consume more hunger.

$(#ffffff)【War Scythe】——Sickle $(br)   Passive: Sweeping Blade — Increases slash damage and range. $(br)   Skill: Reap — Strikes targets within a certain range, and killing targets enhances the wielder's abilities. $(br)   Enhancement: Invigorate — Grants abilities upon successful use.

$(#ffffff)【War Adze】——Broad Axe $(br)   Passive: Extra Damage — Significantly increases the Broad Axe's damage. $(br)   Skill: Charge — Charges forward, dealing damage to the first target hit. $(br)   Enhancement: Defensive Stance — When used in the off-hand, the skill provides additional defense.
patchouli.flame_chase_artifacts.book.cat: $(#ffffff)   This section primarily focuses on explaining the optimal combinations in Tetra's vanilla version, as well as some uncommon but highly useful materials (such as gems that are not displayed as inlays on the Holographic Sphere).
patchouli.flame_chase_artifacts.book.ent: §fSpecial Bow Modifications

$(#ffffff)   Within the Forge Ruins, players can obtain Bolts, Quick-Release Pins, and Planar Stabilizers. Bolts can be crafted into Arrow Rests with configurable attribute values, Quick-Release Pins can be used to improve bowstrings, and Planar Stabilizers can be used to enhance bow arms. For details, refer to the [Forge Ruins] section. $(br)   Bolts can use the 'Configuration' page to balance attributes such as Draw Time and Arrow Speed. $(br)   Quick-Release Pins can increase the bow's draw speed and grant the bow auto-fire capability. $(br)   Planar Stabilizers enable arrows to fly without gravity and increase arrow flight speed by 20%%.
§fVanilla Inlayable Items Overview

$(#ffffff)   Inlayable items in Tetra's vanilla version are hidden by default in the Holographic Sphere's material list unless you navigate to Tools - Bindings - Inlays to view the list. Since many players are unaware of this, a dedicated chapter is provided to explain it.
$(#ffffff)   Inlaying Lapis Lazuli provides a level 1 Intuition (Experience Sharpening) effect and increases durability by 48 points.
$(#ffffff)   Inlaying Amethyst provides 0.5 Reach and Attack Range, a 22%% Long Arm effect, and increases durability by 48 points.
$(#ffffff)   Inlaying Emerald provides a 15%% Critical Hit Chance and 200%% Critical Hit Damage, and increases durability by 48 points.
$(#ffffff)   Inlaying Diamond provides a 10%% Attack Damage Bonus and enhances the tool's efficiency, while increasing durability by 512 points.

$(#ffffff)   Inlaying Ender Pearl provides a level 2 Shake effect, which attracts nearby loot within a 2-block radius (equivalent to the trait level) upon destruction or killing, but has a 1%% chance to spawn an Endermite. It also increases durability by 48 points.
$(#ffffff)   Inlaying Nether Star increases durability by 512 points and triggers the synergy effect between the Nether Star and the vanilla tool head component—enhancing the tool level by 1.
§fAcquiring High-Quality

$(#ffffff)   The High-Quality attribute can percentage-wise enhance a tool's attack power, draw strength, skill damage, and mining efficiency, making it an exceptionally valuable attribute. In the vanilla version, it can only be provided by [Material Specialization Scrolls] and [Planar Stabilizers]. $(br)   Material Specialization Scrolls can be obtained by finding villages but only provide a level 1 High-Quality. However, since Forge Hammers cannot affect materials used for non-hammer tools such as axes and knives, they remain useful (e.g., for wood, fiber).

$(#ffffff)   Planar Stabilizers, when installed on a Forge Hammer, provide High-Quality 1/2 based on the number used when crafting components with the Forge Hammer. They are the primary source of the High-Quality attribute for components made from hammer-processable materials such as metals. $(br)   Priority: Tool in hand > Tool on the rack > Forge Hammer. Therefore, when using a Planar Stabilizer-equipped Forge Hammer, you need to remove hammers from nearby tool racks; otherwise, the High-Quality attribute will not apply.
patchouli.flame_chase_artifacts.book.cat: $(#ffffff)   This section primarily provides a brief overview of the unique characteristics of various types of tool components. (This section contains some author interpretations and is for reference only.)
patchouli.flame_chase_artifacts.book.ent: §fSwords — Basic Blade
$(#ffffff)   A basic blade with average damage, attack speed, and integrity. It has no special abilities, and its values serve as the baseline for evaluating other blade types. $(br)
§fSwords — Short Blade

$(#ffffff)   A blade component that allows off-hand attacks. When performing a right-click attack while holding it in the off-hand, missing an attack does not trigger a cooldown, making it suitable for use with area-of-effect or slow-attacking weapons. The damage dealt during off-hand attacks increases based on the material used. If the material is Netherite, the damage dealt while holding it in the off-hand can exceed that of the main hand. $(br)
§fSwords — Heavy Blade

$(#ffffff)   Heavy blades sacrifice attack speed to increase damage and sweeping capabilities. They primarily rely on the True Sweep trait for attacks, so it is best to pair them with a grip ring and the Sweeping Edge enchantment. $(br)   Grip rings significantly increase the sweep range, while Sweeping Edge directly increases the sweep damage multiplier. The hardness of the material directly affects the sweep damage multiplier.
§fSwords — Machete
$(#ffffff)   Machetes have a lower attack profile but possess the special ability to cut through webs and plants within an area. They are generally used as gathering tools. $(br)
§fSwords — Throwing Knife
$(#ffffff)   Throwing knives are blade components that can be thrown and are best used with the Loyalty enchantment. $(br)
§fSwords — Basic Hilt
$(#ffffff)   The hilt is the primary source of a sword's integrity. $(br)
§fSwords — Wrapped Handle

$(#ffffff)   Wrapping the handle with a given material can slightly increase damage and swing speed based on the material's attributes, while also reducing potential negative effects caused by the handle. $(br)
§fSwords — Counterweight

$(#ffffff)   Increases attack speed by 0.15. If the counterweight's effect level differs from the item's total integrity, the bonus decreases by 0.05 for each point of difference between the total integrity and the effect level. $(br)   Author's note: Increasing attack speed by only 0.15 results in relatively poor in-combat performance compared to a grip ring.
§fSwords — Grip Loop

$(#ffffff)   Adds a grip loop to the hilt, increasing the sword's attack range. It enhances the Sweeping Edge attack range by 2 blocks. $(br)   Non-heavy blades can do without it, but it is essential for heavy blades.
§fSwords — Wide Guard

$(#ffffff)   When equipped on a sword, this component provides additional armor value when the sword is held in the main or off-hand, making it a versatile component. $(br)   It can be chosen when there are no suitable inlay materials to enhance attributes. Netherite wide guards offer up to 5.5 armor value.
§fSwords — Binding
$(#ffffff)   Reinforces the connection between the blade and the hilt using fiber, providing additional integrity to the tool but significantly reducing attack speed. $(br)
§fSwords — Forefinger Ring

$(#ffffff)   Attaches a ring to the hilt, increasing the minimum damage dealt during attack cooldowns. $(br)   It can be paired with slower weapons to benefit from guaranteed damage, but heavy swords require a full cooldown to perform sweeps.
§fSwords — Reinforced Fuller

$(#ffffff)   At the cost of reduced attack speed, this component provides additional integrity and extra material traits to the tool. $(br)   It is highly effective when paired with materials that possess special ability traits or provide substantial integrity.
§fBow Tools — Straight Stave
$(#ffffff)   The Straight Stave holds the same status as a normal blade, with average draw speed and draw power, and has no special features. $(br)
§fBow Tools — Long Stave

$(#ffffff)   The Long Stave has a slower draw speed but greater draw power. $(br)   You may consider aiming for high single-arrow damage. For the bow body, it is recommended to pair it with a stabilizer made from an arm adjuster or planar stabilizer.
§fBow Tools — Recurve Stave

$(#ffffff)   The Recurve Stave has a shorter draw time. $(br)   Since the draw power of the bow body can be enhanced through enchantments and sharpening, while the draw time can only be reduced by sharpening the bow body, the draw time of the Recurve Stave can be considered a rare multiplier zone. For component combinations, it is recommended to pair it with an extended arrow rest and an arm adjuster.
§fBow Tools — Arm Adjuster

$(#ffffff)   The Arm Adjuster can only be crafted using bolts. By adjusting the tightness of the bolts, you can modify the draw time and draw power of the bow. $(br)   You can make reasonable adjustments to the attributes according to your needs.
§fBow Tools — Extended Arrow Rest

$(#ffffff)   The Extended Arrow Rest allows you to shoot multiple arrows at once, but it also consumes multiple arrows. Therefore, it is recommended to pair it with the Infinity enchantment. $(br)   An extended arrow rest made from bolts is stronger than one made from Netherite and can be used with fast-firing bows to improve accuracy or to deal with large numbers of enemies.
§fBow Tools — Sight

$(#ffffff)   The Sight increases arrow spread and allows you to see farther when aiming with a bow or holding the [Shift] key. $(br)   It can be considered for use when you don't have mods like HD Fix that allow zooming via shortcut keys.
§fBow Tools — Stabilizer
$(#ffffff)   The Stabilizer can increase the speed of the arrow when it is shot. If it is made from a planar stabilizer, the arrow can also ignore gravity. $(br)
§fDouble-Headed Tools — Adze

$(#ffffff)   The Adze has both digging and logging levels, and can serve the functions of both a shovel and an axe. $(br)   It should be noted that the tool levels of the Adze for both functions are lower compared to those of a shovel head and an axe head.
§fDouble-Headed Tools — Axe

$(#ffffff)   The Axe can be used to chop wooden blocks or peel logs, and has a chance to cause a shield break effect. When necessary, it can also be used as a weapon to chop enemies. $(br)   If conditions permit, it is recommended to craft an axe and hang it on a tool rack to process materials that require a chopping level, such as wood, into tool components.
§fDouble-Headed Tools — Pickaxe

$(#ffffff)   The Pickaxe has a natural -1 tool level. It needs to be paired with another pickaxe head (or a component with a synergy effect from the add-on mod) to match the tool level with the corresponding level of the raw material. $(br)
§fDouble-Headed Tools — Tool Butt
$(#ffffff)   The Tool Butt can improve the mining efficiency and usage speed of the tool. $(br)
§fDouble-Headed Tools — Hammer

$(#ffffff)   The Hammer has a natural -1 tool level. It needs to be paired with another hammer head (or a component with a synergy effect from the add-on mod) to match the tool level with the corresponding level of the raw material. $(br)   It should be noted that when making a hammer head from obsidian or Netherite, the required tool level will be higher than that for making other components.
§fDouble-Headed Tools — Claw
$(#ffffff)   The Claw can be used to pry open items and quickly break wooden blocks. It is an almost essential tool component before entering the Forge Ruins. $(br)
§fDouble-Headed Tools — Hoe
$(#ffffff)   The Hoe is no different from the vanilla hoe. $(br)
§fDouble-Headed Tools — Sickle

$(#ffffff)   The Sickle can cut a patch of plants and has a farming tool level one level lower than that of a hoe. $(br)   Additionally, the Sickle has a sweeping ability and can also be used to chop enemies when necessary.
§fSingle-Headed Tools — Shovel Head
$(#ffffff)   A tool head identical to the vanilla shovel. In addition to digging soil and sand, you can right-click on dirt to create grass paths. $(br)
§fSingle-Headed Tools — Spearhead
$(#ffffff)   A head modification that can be used to stab enemies. $(br)
§fSingle-Headed Tools — Trident
$(#ffffff)   A special component inherently attached to the trident. It cannot be actively crafted or have its material replaced. $(br)
§fSingle-Headed Tools — Lightweight Handle
$(#ffffff)   A lightweight handle that allows the tool to be thrown like a trident, but provides less integrity. $(br)
§fSingle-Headed Tools — Long Handle
$(#ffffff)   A long handle that provides a longer attack range for single-headed tools but reduces attack speed. $(br)
§fCrossbow Tools — Crossbow Stock
$(#ffffff)   A standard crossbow stock. In the vanilla version, this is your only option. $(br)
§fCrossbow Tools — Crossbow Body
$(#ffffff)   A standard crossbow body. In the vanilla version, this is your only option. $(br)
§fCrossbow Tools — Stirrup
$(#ffffff)   A standard stirrup that increases draw speed. In the vanilla version, this is your only option. $(br)
§fShield Tools — Tower Shield
$(#ffffff)   A tower shield that can maintain a defensive stance continuously. However, it consumes more integrity than other shields and has a longer cooldown recovery time. $(br)
§fShield Tools — Heater Shield

$(#ffffff)   A heater shield. Holding the right-click button will initiate a defensive stance for a certain duration. After the stance ends, the shield will enter a cooldown period, and you must wait for the cooldown to end before you can defend again. $(br)
§fShield Tools — Buckler
$(#ffffff)   A buckler that provides armor toughness but cannot be used for active defense. $(br)
§fShield Tools — Aerodynamic Trim

$(#ffffff)   An aerodynamic trim that allows the shield to be thrown like a trident to deal damage (like Captain America.jpg). However, for shields capable of active defense, they need to be in stealth mode during the defensive stance for the throw to occur after the stance ends. $(br)   It is recommended to pair it with the Loyalty enchantment.
§fShield Tools — Spike
$(#ffffff)   A spike that has a chance to damage attackers when defending against melee attacks. It is recommended to pair it with a tower shield. $(br)
§fShield Tools — Sturdy Boss

$(#ffffff)   A sturdy boss that allows the shield to be right-clicked to smash enemies and apply a stun effect. However, for shields capable of active defense, stealth mode is required to attack. It is recommended to pair it with a buckler and a heater shield. $(br)
patchouli.flame_chase_artifacts.book.cat: $(#ffffff)   This section recommends useful and high-quality Tetra addon mods to enhance your gameplay experience.
patchouli.flame_chase_artifacts.book.ent: §f[More Materials] MoreModTetra

$(#ffffff)   More Mod Tetra, also known as More Materials Tetra (abbreviated as MMT, just search for MMT), is another Tetra addon mod created by the author of this Patchouli guide. The primary purpose of this mod is to add more practical materials and components to Tetra, as well as ensure compatibility with materials from various popular mods. $(br)   In terms of components, MMT introduces new parts such as tachi, wakizashi, kitchen knives, naginata, and blade bows. It also provides specialized tools for mods featuring unique tools like Flesh Reborn, Dreamlands, Spirit Calamity, and Arcane Magic.

$(#ffffff)   Currently, this mod is compatible with Cataclysm, Ice and Fire, Flesh Reborn, Dreamlands, Spirit Calamity, Mystical Agriculture, New Magic, Botania, Create: Above and Beyond, Create, Torchmaster, Deep Mob Learning, AgriCraft, Endless Greed, Draconic Evolution, Forbidden and Arcanus, and more. $(br)   Additionally, MMT is compatible with various industrial mods, including zinc, nickel, platinum, aluminum, lead, tin, silver, uranium, steel, tungsten, iridium, osmium, as well as rubies, emeralds, aquamarines, and onyx.

$(#ffffff)   For sharpening, MMT adds numerous scrolls that provide powerful sharpening options. Examples include the Transcendent Inscription Scroll, which offers various attack attribute enhancements; the Fortune Infusion Scroll, which provides critical hit chance and critical hit damage; the Elven Bowcrafting Scroll, which adds more attributes to bows; and the Soul Artisan Scroll, which increases the integrity cap.
§f[JEI Compatibility] JEI Tetra

$(#ffffff)   JEI Tetra makes ScrollItem, which was previously invisible in JEI, now display properly, facilitating players' ability to search for scroll items and their crafting recipes. $(br)   "Replacement" Page: Players can now use JEI's "Uses" page to check if an item can be converted into a Tetra item, making it easier to understand item replacement possibilities. $(br)   "Actions" Page: Players can now use JEI's "Uses" page to check if an item can perform specific actions on the crafting bench, facilitating understanding of the item's uses on the crafting bench.
§f[Quick Sharpening] GrindstoneHoning

$(#ffffff)   GrindstoneHoning allows players to sharpen and reinforce their Tetra items using a grindstone. $(br)   "Players need to place their modular items in the slot located below the grindstone to use this feature. It consumes durability for sharpening, with the amount of durability consumed affected by durability enchantments. Using this mod enables players to quickly bypass the tedious process of sharpening items."
§f[Quick Attribute Comparison] Tetra View

$(#ffffff)   This mod adds a page that allows for easier viewing and comparison of Tetra item attributes. $(br)   In-game key V: View attributes of the item in the main hand; In GUI interface, key V: View attributes of the currently selected item; In GUI interface, key C (after selecting an item): Add the item to the comparison list for comparison with other items.
§f[Holographic Sphere Expansion] Extra Holo Page

$(#ffffff)   Adds an additional holographic sphere interface to display items from addon mods, along with enhanced material tooltips that provide more detailed material data. It modifies the schematic requirements for holographic spheres, allows viewing of schematic rarity restrictions, adjusts the spacing on the improvement page, enables opening the holographic sphere via keypress, allows modification of the spacing between improvements, and permits resource packs to register tool bars.
§f[Art of Forging] ArtOfForging

$(#ffffff)   This mod adds new components and upgrades to Tetra, many of which are inspired by real-world or popular culture weapons. $(br)   The mod also modifies the loot tables of standard dungeon chests. Each scroll now has its own weight and rarity, making specific schematics harder to obtain. Among the added scrolls, six are craftable, and five can be found in vanilla and some other mod dungeons. $(br)   AOF also introduces a new accessory called the Strange Trinket, which can provide potion effects by adding different materials to three slots.
§f[Easy Verification Forging] TetraClip

$(#ffffff)   This mod optimizes certain aspects of Tetra and fixes bugs related to other Tetra-linked mods. $(br)   ① Adds a slider at the bottom of the Tetra Crafting Bench (and Forge Bench) interface for easier viewing of the current tool's attributes. $(br)   ② Adds pagination functionality to the interface used for comparing the same attribute across different materials in Tetra. $(br)   ③ Fixes an issue with the AOF item effect "Judgment" where kills were not counted towards the player's kill count; fixes an issue with the item effect "Mystic Blade" where kills were not counted; improves the "Gloria" boss damage bonus condition (now any entity with the forge:bosses tag is considered a boss).
§f[Tool Level Booster] TetraToolbooster

$(#ffffff)   This mod adds several craftable items for Tetra that serve as inset components for two-handed tools, used to enhance tool levels. $(br)   There are two types of items that can increase the axe, pickaxe, and hoe levels, each providing a +1/+2 tool level bonus. The hammer item is specifically designed to enhance hammer levels, providing a +3 hammer level bonus. Creative mode items can increase the levels of the aforementioned four types of tools by 10. $(br)   The mod aims to provide a more direct method for players experiencing development setbacks (such as those unable to find a forge hammer) to bypass Tetra's original forging upgrade progression system. However, it may disrupt game balance.
§f[Slash Blade] SlashBladeTetra

$(#ffffff)   SlashBladeTetra deeply integrates the classic mod Slash Blade with Tetra, allowing players to disassemble the iconic red-black blade into multiple modular components and enhance them through combat to craft customized Tetra slash blades. $(br)   【Mod Features】$(br)   Modular Slash Blade System: The slash blade is divided into four main components—blade, tsuba (guard), handle, and scabbard—each of which can be independently upgraded and enhanced. Upon reaching a thousand kills and becoming a demon blade, an additional soul component is added. $(br)   Visual Assembly Interface: Use Tetra's crafting bench to freely combine different parts and preview attribute changes in real-time.

$(#ffffff)   Combat-Driven Growth Mechanism: Accumulate "Enemy Kills" through monster slaying to unlock more Tetra modification slots, gradually enhancing the slash blade's potential. $(br)   Style Meets Performance: Freely mix and match to create unique weapons that are both aesthetically pleasing and functional. $(br)   Deep Balance Design: Each component influences combat performance, encouraging players to experiment with different combinations to find their preferred playstyle. $(br)   【The above content is copied from MC百科】
§f[Giant Tools] SecretsOfForging

$(#ffffff)   This mod adds a new template, The Polearm (giant single-headed tool), to Tetra. By crafting a spear of any material using the crafting bench and modifying it on the processing bench, it links with AoF's katana and halberd schematics to upgrade them into naginata and halberds. $(br)   Additionally, this mod adds three new components to the sword template.
patchouli.flame_chase_artifacts.book.cat: $(#ffffff)   This section primarily introduces the [Belt] item added by the Tetra mod. While this item has numerous practical functions in the vanilla game, it can feel somewhat out of place when included in modpacks without modifications.
patchouli.flame_chase_artifacts.book.ent: §fBelt Leveling Path

$(#ffffff)   The Tetra belt levels are: String (crafted directly) → Any Wool → Leather → Iron Ingot → Shulker Shell. The String, Wool, and Leather levels each increase integrity by 1 point, the Iron Ingot level provides 2 points of integrity, and the Shulker Shell level provides 3 points of integrity. $(br)   The belt's three functional slots require integrity to embed components, so higher-level belts have a higher functional capacity.
§fBelt Component — Belt Strap

$(#ffffff)   The Belt Strap can add special slots to the belt that allow for quick carrying and accessing of tools or other items. The number of Belt Straps affects the number of quick-access slots. Iron Belt Straps consume less integrity compared to Leather ones. $(br)   When holding the belt or wearing it with an accessory mod installed, holding down the shortcut key (default is B) will display the quick-access slots. Moving the mouse over an item in the slot and releasing the shortcut key will retrieve the item. (There is a bug where items retrieved quickly may mysteriously disappear.) $(br)   Note: If the Belt Strap space exceeds 8, it may cause the game to crash (not possible in the vanilla game).
§fBelt Component — Potion Pouch

$(#ffffff)   The Potion Pouch provides the belt with a small pouch specifically designed to carry potions. It can store a large number of potions but can hold only a few types of potions. $(br)   Each Potion Pouch slot can store 64 potions. If there isn't a particularly convenient storage method, the belt can even be used as a potion storage container. $(br)   The Potion Pouch can be crafted using Rabbit Hide, White Wool, Leather, and Flexible Network, with each material providing 1/2/3/4 Potion Pouch slots respectively. $(br)   Note: If the Potion Pouch space exceeds 10, it may cause the game to crash (not possible in the vanilla game).
§fBelt Component — Storage Pouch

$(#ffffff)   The Storage Pouch provides the belt with space to store items, acting as an alternative backpack. $(br)   The Storage Pouch can be crafted using Rabbit Hide, White Wool, Flexible Network Leather, providing 4/6/13/16 Storage Pouch slots respectively. $(br)   Note: If the Storage Pouch space exceeds 32, it may cause the game to crash (not possible in the vanilla game).
§fBelt Component — Quiver

$(#ffffff)   The Quiver provides the belt with a quiver that can hold a large number of arrows. The Quiver can be crafted using Rabbit Hide, White Wool, Flexible Network Leather, providing 2/4/6/7 Quiver slots respectively. $(br)   Note: Arrows in the Quiver cannot be directly used as ammunition without Quick Release Pin modifications; they must be taken out and placed in the inventory to be used by bows or crossbows. Additionally, if the Quiver space exceeds 30, it may cause the game to crash (not possible in the vanilla game).
§fBelt Component — Booster

$(#ffffff)   The Booster can be crafted using Iron Ingots. It can enhance the player's jump level and enable flight under certain conditions. $(br)   Crouching before jumping, jumping in mid-air, or flying with Elytra can activate the Booster's flight capability, but it requires gunpowder from the tool belt inventory as fuel.
§fBelt Component — Suspender

$(#ffffff)   The Suspender's recipe is only visible when the player has a [Planar Stabilizer] in their inventory. $(br)   When there are [Beacons] and [Tide Cores] (the conduits mentioned in the trait description are actually the English term for Tide Cores) nearby, the belt wearer can hover in mid-air.
§fBelt Component Improvement — Quick Release Pin

$(#ffffff)   The [Quick Release Pin Improvement] is an option unlocked when the player has a Quick Release Pin in their inventory. It can be used to improve Storage Pouches, Belt Straps, and Quivers. $(br)   When improving the Quiver, the arrows inside can be directly used as ammunition by bows or crossbows. $(br)   When improving the Belt Strap, it allows for quickly attempting to equip the first suitable tool for breaking the facing block (the tool must be within the improved Belt Strap) via the shortcut key. $(br)   When improving the Storage Pouch, it allows for quickly storing the item in hand into the Storage Pouch space via the shortcut key.
§f[Greatsword] Tetra: Re-Enlarged

$(#ffffff)   This mod adds 32x pixel modular tools. When linked with the katana scroll from AoF, it can be upgraded into a great katana, and when linked with the Sengoku weapon scroll from MMT, it can be upgraded into an odachi. $(br)

patchouli.flame_chase_artifacts.book.lan: $(#ffffff)The Tetra mod revolves around modular items and strives to integrate them with concepts such as adventure and technology. This handbook aims to address the lack of guidance in the Tetra mod. However, most of the content is derived from player tutorials and the author's understanding. Please forgive any errors or omissions.
